Tetragone: A Lesson in Security Fundamentals
The Chemist Who Killed the Most People in History

stories.text:
This is a hail mary, but I'm out of ideas. I'm trying to remember the name of a tech blog I remember really enjoying reading a few years ago. All I remember was:

- The content of the blog was mostly focused on a variety of interesting math, and computer science topics. The blog was extremely well organized, and covered a breadth of topics.

- The UI for the blog had a light purple theme.

- The avatar the author used was a Touhou character (I think?)

- I think the author's username started with an "N".

Does this sound familiar to anyone? Oh if only I'd bookmarked it!
stories.title: Ask HN: What Is the Name of This Blog?
Ask HN: Are faster queries on your SIEM a vitamin or a painkiller?

stories.text:
I know Iâ€™m not alone in browsing hacker news on my phone.

On mobile devices the flag/hide buttons are super close to the article and comment links. I hit them all the time unintentionally.

Maybe hacker news could throw an @media section in the CSS and make the links large enough to avoid accidental taps on mobile?

I have the same development philosphy as HN, roughly doing a minimal implementation that is close to what the machine requires. But I also value an interface that humans can use. I think with a couple lines of code HN could make this more usable without corrupting the spirit of a no-frills website.
stories.title: Time for Some Mobile CSS?
